text: Circle Hot Springs, Alaska is a holiday resort in Alaska. It is 137 miles northeast of Fairbanks. The hotel was built in 1930. The Athabasca people were the first to use the hot springs. In 1893, William Greats discovered the springs. In 1905 the land around the springs was sold for farming and a resort was opened in 1909. The main feature of Circle Hot Springs is a very large hot pool. There is a story that the hotel is haunted by a ghost. ==References== Category:Geography of Alaska Category:1909 establishments in the United States Category:1900s establishments in Alaska
title: Circle Hot Springs, Alaska
